summary: The document details the activities and characteristics of Valentin Sorgeyevich Loginov, a Soviet individual active in Latin America, specifically Havana, from 1960 to 1963. It highlights his involvement in recruitment efforts, including an attempt to recruit a policeman, his complex personality traits, social behaviors, language skills, and specific incidents he was involved in. The document paints a picture of a confident, crafty individual with a multifaceted personality.
key_findings: Loginov engaged in recruitment activities, notably attempting to recruit a policeman at 5000 Pesos per month.
Exhibited a complex personality: aggressive and dictatorial yet capable of gentleness.
Socially active with a notable interest in women, described as a woman-chaser.
Fluent in Spanish with minimal accent and had fair English proficiency.
Perceived as crafty and tough, displaying confidence and self-assurance in interactions with non-Soviets.
Involved in specific incidents, including an altercation with a guard and pursuing Ansloich/3, possibly for romantic reasons.
